q: Change is never easy, but always possible.
h:
“Change is never easy, but always possible.” —
Barack Obama

q: Failure is just information and an opportunity to change your course.
h:
“Failure is just information and an opportunity to change your course.” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: To lose your temper is only useful once a year.
h:
“To lose your temper is only useful once a year.” —
Colin R. Davis

q: Don't be afraid to give up the good to go for the great.
h:
“Don't be afraid to give up the good to go for the great.” —
John D. Rockefeller

q: Do not look for approval except for the consciousness of doing your best.
h:
“Do not look for approval except for the consciousness of doing your best.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: Growth comes at the point of resistance.
h:
“Growth comes at the point of resistance.” —
Josh Waitzkin

q: Animals don't hate, and we're supposed to be better than them.
h:
“Animals don't hate, and we're supposed to be better than them.” —
Elvis Presley

q: What are we doing here, that is the question.
h:
“What are we doing here, that is the question.” —
Samuel Beckett

q: Don't listen to the person who has the answers; listen to the person who has the questions.
h:
“Don't listen to the person who has the answers; listen to the person who has the questions.” —
Albert Einstein

q: I will not walk backward in life.
h:
“I will not walk backward in life.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: Success is liking yourself, liking what you do, and liking how you do it.
h:
“Success is liking yourself, liking what you do, and liking how you do it.” —
Maya Angelou

q: May you find grace as you surrender to life. May you find happiness, as you stop seeking it.
h:
“May you find grace as you surrender to life. May you find happiness, as you stop seeking it.” —
Dan Millman

q: If you want to find the secrets of the universe, think in terms of energy, frequency and vibration.
h:
“If you want to find the secrets of the universe, think in terms of energy, frequency and vibration. ” —
Nikola Tesla

q: We are willing to believe anything other than the truth.
h:
“We are willing to believe anything other than the truth.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past.
h:
“So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past.” —
F. Scott Fitzgerald

q: Confidence breeds beauty.
h:
“Confidence breeds beauty. ” —
Estee Lauder

q: The more you extend kindness to yourself, the more it will become your automatic response to others.
h:
“The more you extend kindness to yourself, the more it will become your automatic response to others.” —
Wayne Dyer

q: Absorb what is useful, discard what is useless and add what is specifically your own.
h:
“Absorb what is useful, discard what is useless and add what is specifically your own. ” —
Bruce Lee

q: Youth ages, immaturity is outgrown, ignorance can be educated, and drunkenness sobered, but stupid lasts forever.
h:
“Youth ages, immaturity is outgrown, ignorance can be educated, and drunkenness sobered, but stupid lasts forever.” —
Aristophanes

q: We must accept finite disappointment, but never lose infinite hope.
h:
“We must accept finite disappointment, but never lose infinite hope.” —
Martin Luther King, Jr.

q: He who knows how to wait need make no concessions.
h:
“He who knows how to wait need make no concessions.” —
Sigmund Freud

q: But better die than live mechanically a life that is a repetition of repetitions.
h:
“But better die than live mechanically a life that is a repetition of repetitions.” —
D. H. Lawrence

q: Repetition does not transform a lie into a truth.
h:
“Repetition does not transform a lie into a truth.” —
Franklin D. Roosevelt

q: I can never decide whether my dreams are the result of my thoughts or my thoughts the result of my dreams.
h:
“I can never decide whether my dreams are the result of my thoughts or my thoughts the result of my dreams.” —
D. H. Lawrence

q: Humor isn't for everyone. It's only for people who want to have fun, enjoy life, and feel alive.
h:
“Humor isn't for everyone. It's only for people who want to have fun, enjoy life, and feel alive.” —
Anne Wilson Schaef

q: The highest form of ignorance is when you reject something you don't know anything about.
h:
“The highest form of ignorance is when you reject something you don't know anything about. ” —
Wayne Dyer

q: Good luck is opportunity meeting preparedness.
h:
“Good luck is opportunity meeting preparedness.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
h:
“You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.” —
Les Brown

q: The Only Thing That Is Constant Is Change
h:
“The Only Thing That Is Constant Is Change” —
Heraclitus

q: The health of nations is more important than the wealth of nations.
h:
“The health of nations is more important than the wealth of nations.” —
Will Rogers

q: The future is no more uncertain than the present.
h:
“The future is no more uncertain than the present.” —
Walt Whitman

q: Your only limitations are those you set up in your mind or permit others to set up for you.
h:
“Your only limitations are those you set up in your mind or permit others to set up for you.” —
Og Mandino

q: Life is ten percent what you experience and ninety percent how you respond to it.
h:
“Life is ten percent what you experience and ninety percent how you respond to it.” —
Unknown

q: A scientific man ought to have no wishes, no affections, - a mere heart of stone.
h:
“A scientific man ought to have no wishes, no affections, - a mere heart of stone.” —
Charles Darwin

q: Your first and foremost job as a leader is to take charge of your own energy and then help to orchestrate the energy of those around you.
h:
“Your first and foremost job as a leader is to take charge of your own energy and then help to orchestrate the energy of those around you.” —
Peter Drucker

q: One must be deeply aware of the impermanence of the world.
h:
“One must be deeply aware of the impermanence of the world.” —
Dogen

q: Human behavior flows from three main sources: desire, emotion, and knowledge.
h:
“Human behavior flows from three main sources: desire, emotion, and knowledge.” —
Plato

q: Nothing good ever comes of violence.
h:
“Nothing good ever comes of violence.” —
Martin Luther

q: Art is to console those who are broken by life.
h:
“Art is to console those who are broken by life.” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: The law of harvest is to reap more than you sow. Sow an act, and you reap a habit. Sow a habit and you reap a character. Sow a character and you reap a destiny.
h:
“The law of harvest is to reap more than you sow. Sow an act, and you reap a habit. Sow a habit and you reap a character. Sow a character and you reap a destiny.” —
James Allen

q: Nothing is too high for a man to reach, but he must climb with care and confidence
h:
“Nothing is too high for a man to reach, but he must climb with care and confidence” —
Hans Christian Andersen

q: You're braver than you believe, and stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think.
h:
“You're braver than you believe, and stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think.” —
A.A. Milne

q: Never spend your money before you have earned it.
h:
“Never spend your money before you have earned it.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: We don't stumble accidentally into an amazing life. It takes decision, a commitment to consistently work on ourselves.
h:
“We don't stumble accidentally into an amazing life. It takes decision, a commitment to consistently work on ourselves.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: If the only prayer you ever say in your entire life is thank you, it will be enough.
h:
“If the only prayer you ever say in your entire life is thank you, it will be enough.” —
Meister Eckhart

q: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
h:
“The best way to predict the future is to create it.” —
Abraham Lincoln

q: Resilience is not what happens to you. It's how you react to, respond to, and recover from what happens to you.
h:
“Resilience is not what happens to you. It's how you react to, respond to, and recover from what happens to you.” —
Jeffrey Gitomer

q: Enthusiasm makes up for a host of deficiencies.
h:
“Enthusiasm makes up for a host of deficiencies.” —
Barack Obama

q: I am thankful to all who said no to me. It is because of them that I'm doing it myself.
h:
“I am thankful to all who said no to me. It is because of them that I'm doing it myself.” —
Albert Einstein

q: A man that flies from his fear may find that he has only taken a short cut to meet it.
h:
“A man that flies from his fear may find that he has only taken a short cut to meet it.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien
